TestDescription.name: SMB null session
TestDescription.Description: It's possible to establish a NULL session to this host. A null session is a session established with a server when no credentials are supplied. Use of null sessions, however, can expose information to an anonymous user that could compromise security on a system.
TestDescription.Recommendation: It's recommended to disallow null sessions to the fullest extent possible.

Reference.database: Restricting information available to anonymous logon users
How to use the RestrictAnonymous registry value in Windows 2000
